Content: Which detail in Passage 1 shows that “lava is like a fingerprint”?

A.Choice: Lava is present in various locations on Earth.

B.Choice: Lava samples reveal unique aspects of volcanoes.

C.Choice: Lava rises within Earth's volcanoes in different ways.

D.Choice: Lava requires special equipment during scientists' research.

Content: :ibox:𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗛𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗪𝗢 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦.
Read this sentence from paragraph 7 in Passage 1.
:box:Volcanoes have a significant effect on the topography, or landscape, of Earth.
The author supports this claim 𝗠𝗔𝗜𝗡𝗟𝗬 by

A.Choice: giving examples of volcanic formations.

B.Choice: suggesting that volcanoes are dangerous.

C.Choice: comparing ancient volcanoes to newer ones.

D.Choice: emphasizing that people are aware of volcanic activity.

Content: Which choice provides the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 evidence for the answer to the previous question?

A.Choice: “From that analysis, scientists can learn much about the volcano.”

B.Choice: “Some of these volcanoes are still active.”

C.Choice: “Undersea eruptions continue to occur, and new islands pop up from time to time.”

D.Choice: “It last erupted about 144 million years ago and is now extinct.”

Content: In Passage 1, which choice could 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 replace the word “probe” in paragraph 12?

A.Choice: protect

B.Choice: investigate

C.Choice: travel inside

D.Choice: read about

Content: Based on Passage 2, how does the movement of lava create lava tubes?

A.Choice: Lava flows and then coats the walls of existing caves.

B.Choice: Hot lava gradually burns holes through mountainsides.

C.Choice: Hot lava travels downward and the outer part of the flow becomes solid.

D.Choice: Lava covers new areas and plant roots cut deeply into the hardened soil.

Content: According to Passage 2, what are 𝗧𝗪𝗢 ways volcanoes affect Hawaii? Select 𝗧𝗪𝗢 answers.

A.Choice: They are the main energy source for households on the islands.

B.Choice: They create interest and appeal for visiting tourists.

C.Choice: They provide shelter from environmental hazards.

D.Choice: They allow toxic materials to flow away safely.

E.Choice: They form habitats for living things.

Content: What was the author's 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 𝗟𝗜𝗞𝗘𝗟𝗬 purpose for writing Passage 2?

A.Choice: to present information about the results of volcanic activity

B.Choice: to offer differing opinions on the causes of volcanic eruptions

C.Choice: to show that volcanic activity is not as common as it has been in the past

D.Choice: to describe methods scientists use to study what happens after volcanic eruptions

Content: What is one difference between the information presented in Passage 1 and Passage 2?

A.Choice: Passage 1 explains one theory about volcanoes, and Passage 2 gives data challenging that theory.

B.Choice: Passage 1 focuses on the causes of eruptions, while Passage 2 focuses on specific details about the role of volcanoes.

C.Choice: Passage 1 explains one scientist's research project in chronological order, while Passage 2 provides descriptive details about one volcanic area.

D.Choice: Passage 1 describes the tasks volcanologists perform, while Passage 2 emphasizes the need to have more people who study volcanic activity.

Content: In paragraph 2, what is the impact of the word “stamina”?

A.Choice: It helps the reader visualize the awkward movements of mules.

B.Choice: It helps the reader understand the natural instincts of mules.

C.Choice: It emphasizes the remarkable endurance of mules.

D.Choice: It emphasizes the stubborn personality of mules.

Content: Which detail from the passage 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 shows that mules are good navigators?

A.Choice: They have a natural ability to memorize routes.

B.Choice: They are often used to carry people on long trips.

C.Choice: They are usually able to move quickly along rocky trails.

D.Choice: They have the unique ability to stay calm under pressure.

Content: What is the 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 𝗟𝗜𝗞𝗘𝗟𝗬 reason the author places the section Sᴘᴇᴄɪᴀʟ Qᴜᴀʟɪᴛɪᴇs ᴏꜰ Mᴜʟᴇs before the section Hɪᴋɪɴɢ Aʟᴏɴɢ ᴛʜᴇ Gʀᴀɴᴅ Cᴀɴʏᴏɴ: Cʜᴏᴏsɪɴɢ ᴛʜᴇ Rɪɢʜᴛ Mᴜʟᴇs?

A.Choice: to introduce the historical role of mules before explaining that they have become less significant

B.Choice: to provide general pieces of information about mules before describing a specific use for them

C.Choice: to compare mules to other animals to support an argument of mules' superiority

D.Choice: to establish one theory about mules that will be disproved in a later section

Content: Based on paragraph 10, which sentence describes the 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 important role of the wrangler?

A.Choice: to train mules so they can engage with people safely and peacefully

B.Choice: to examine how skilled mules are at walking across canyon terrain

C.Choice: to make sure mules have enough food and water for the trail tours

D.Choice: to guide the mules carrying the tourists along the canyon trails

Content: :ibox:𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗛𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗪𝗢 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦.
Which sentence 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 states a central idea of the passage?

A.Choice: Mules have been part of many cultures for centuries.

B.Choice: Mules are more intelligent and agile than most people realize.

C.Choice: Many people generally find trail mules stubborn and difficult to control.

D.Choice: Some political leaders became famous for breeding mules to use on farms.

Content: Which choice provides the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 evidence for the answer to the previous question? 1

A.Choice: “Mules have been bred since ancient times.”

B.Choice: “Mules are more capable of learning new tasks and adjusting to their surroundings.”

C.Choice: “It is extremely difficult to get a mule to do something that it does not want to do.”

D.Choice: “He is also known as 'The Father of the American Mule.'”

Content: What was the author's 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 𝗟𝗜𝗞𝗘𝗟𝗬 purpose for writing the passage?

A.Choice: inform the reader about the characteristics and uses of mules

B.Choice: to urge the reader to support efforts to protect and defend mules

C.Choice: to convince the reader of the need for further research on mules

D.Choice: to entertain the reader with amusing incidents involving mules

Content: In Passage 1, what does the narrator mean when he describes Bright Star as having “a sour face like a pickled cucumber”?

A.Choice: Bright Star looks weak and sick.

B.Choice: Bright Star looks mean and evil.

C.Choice: Bright Star looks old and wrinkled.

D.Choice: Bright Star looks miserable and resentful.

Content: In Passage 1, how does the narrator's point of view change as he walks deeper into the tunnel?

A.Choice: He grows even fonder of his father.

B.Choice: His fears threaten to overcome him.

C.Choice: His mind wanders to more pleasant things.

D.Choice: He becomes more keenly aware of his surroundings.

Content: :ibox:𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗛𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗪𝗢 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦.
According to Passage 2, which detail 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 explains why it was difficult for the workers to build the railroad through “the high Sierras”?

A.Choice: The workers tired too quickly because the weather shifted from extreme cold to extreme heat.

B.Choice: The section of the railroad that the workers had to lay tracks extended over 100 miles.

C.Choice: The workers were weak because their diet mainly consisted of dried fish and fruit.

D.Choice: The terrain was steep and the workers had to dig tunnels through mountains.

Content: Which choice from Passage 1 provides the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 evidence for the answer to the previous question?

A.Choice: “At the point where the tunnel began to narrow, men swung pickaxes to widen it chip by chip.”

B.Choice: “Their lean bodies contorted with the effort.”

C.Choice: “I worked my way slowly down the tunnel, mound of rubble by mound, meter by meter.”

D.Choice: “In front of him was a man swathed from head to toe in scarves.”

Content: Which words from Passage 2 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 𝗖𝗟𝗘𝗔𝗥𝗟𝗬 reveal the speaker's point of view on the treatment of Chinese American railroad workers?

A.Choice: efforts, workers, building

B.Choice: development, progress

C.Choice: severe, cruel, meager

D.Choice: sentiments, thanks

Content: Which of the following statements reflects the 𝗠𝗔𝗜𝗡 idea of Passage 2?

A.Choice: Chinese workers were needed to help build railroads because the Central Pacific Railroad Company had only 600 workers in 1864 and needed over 5,000.

B.Choice: Chinese workers faced a range of dangers while building railroads, including the explosives used to blast tunnels and exposure to freezing cold in winter.

C.Choice: Chinese workers worked for low pay under terrible conditions and should be honored for making a valuable contribution to the development of the United States.

D.Choice: Chinese workers used a variety of clever techniques, such as lowering themselves in baskets over steep embankments, to get to places they could not otherwise have reached.

Content: Which historical detail in Passage 2 is expanded upon in Passage 1?

A.Choice: Chinese railroad workers lived simply and cooked their own meals.

B.Choice: Chinese railroad workers often endured cruel and dangerous conditions.

C.Choice: Chinese railroad workers were hired after the project was delayed by years.

D.Choice: Chinese railroad workers suspended themselves from the tops of cliffs to blast tunnel holes.

Content: How is Passage 1 related to John T. Doolittle's speech in Passage 2?

A.Choice: Passage 1 puts human faces on the events described in Passage 2.

B.Choice: Passage 1 shows exceptions to events that are described in Passage 2.

C.Choice: Passage 1 explains what happened after the events described in Passage 2.

D.Choice: Passage 1 is a romanticized version of the real-life events described in Passage 2.

Content: :ibox:𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗛𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗪𝗢 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦.
What is one way the writer effectively introduces the main argument of the passage?

A.Choice: by providing a definition

B.Choice: by giving historical background

C.Choice: by recalling personal memories

D.Choice: by acknowledging an alternate claim

Content: Which choice provides the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 evidence for the answer to the previous question?

A.Choice: “movies have their merits,”

B.Choice: “a recent study shows that watching live theater can benefit us”

C.Choice: “witness the characters' experiences in a powerful way.”

D.Choice: “should have opportunities to attend live theater”

Content: How should the underlined words in sentence 2 be changed to provide the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 transition to the ideas that follow?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: In fact,

C.Choice: In addition,

D.Choice: In contrast,

Content: How should the underlined words in sentence 4 be changed to provide the 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 transition to the ideas that follow?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: In the meantime,

C.Choice: As an illustration,

D.Choice: In the same way,

Content: How should the underlined word in sentence 10 be changed?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: acceptence

C.Choice: acceptanse

D.Choice: acceptince

Content: How should sentence 12 be changed to maintain the style of the passage?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: A high-quality play brings literature to life.

C.Choice: A first-rate play can make literature seem real in a way.

D.Choice: A terrific play means that literature is right in front of your face.

Content: The writer would like to add a concluding statement that restates the main points in the passage. which sentence would be 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧 to add after sentence 13?

A.Choice: Many students would be grateful for the chance to audition at a local theater.

B.Choice: It truly is an excellent way for people to come together and get to know their neighbors.

C.Choice: Not only is live theater a compelling way to tell a story, it also gives audience members glimpses into other points of view.

D.Choice: If theaters distributed surveys regarding the interests of their audience members, they would achieve greater success.

Content: How should the underlined word in sentence 2 be changed to be 𝗠𝗢𝗦𝗧 exact?

A.Choice: measures

B.Choice: reaches

C.Choice: spans

D.Choice: stretches

Content: :ibox:𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗛𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗪𝗢 𝗣𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦.
The writer wants to add a sentence after sentence 6 to describe one challenge Roebling had to overcome when designing the suspension bridge. Which detail does that 𝗕𝗘𝗦𝗧?

A.Choice: This type of bridge had been built all over the world, but the one in Brooklyn was special.

B.Choice: Many engineers tried to design better bridges.

C.Choice: One of the problems of the early designs was that the bridges swayed in heavy winds.

D.Choice: Initially, people were afraid to drive over suspension bridges because they were held up by wires.

Content: Which sentence from the article best supports the answer to the previous question?

A.Choice: “The Brooklyn Bridge is one of the most recognizable structures in the world.”

B.Choice: “Roebling was an engineer who became known for designing suspension bridges.”

C.Choice: “Roebling improved upon existing designs to make them stronger and steadier.”

D.Choice: “This enabled Roebling to increase the span of roadway between the two towers.”

Content: How should the underlined portion of sentence 9 be changed to avoid repeating ideas?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: At 1,600 feet

C.Choice: With a span of 1,600 feet

D.Choice: Because the Brooklyn Bridge was 1,600 feet

Content: What is the purpose of the underlined clause in sentence 11?

A.Choice: to show a specific feeling

B.Choice: to add a piece of evidence

C.Choice: to describe the order of events

D.Choice: to make a connection between ideas

Content: How should the underlined word in sentence 13 be changed to make the relationship between ideas clear?

A.Choice: NO CHANGE

B.Choice: Although

C.Choice: Because

D.Choice: When

Content: How should sentence 14 be changed to maintain the formal style of the article?

A.Choice: Crowds popped in to the dedication ceremony to give a round of applause.

B.Choice: Thousands attended the dedication ceremony to show their appreciation.

C.Choice: Many came to the dedication ceremony to say they thought the new bridge was cool.

D.Choice: Tons of people showed up at the dedication ceremony to say thanks for the new bridge.

Content: Now read the writing task and draft a response. As you write, think about what makes writing successful.
problems/NMG7E/media/33a.jpg

:box:You have read two passages about Chaco Culture National Historical Park. The two passages include information about what visitors to the park might see, experience, and learn during a visit to the park. Think about what makes Chaco Culture National Historical Park a place worth visiting.

Write an article that could be printed in your school newspaper to inform readers what makes Chaco Culture National Historical Park a good place for visitors to go on an overnight camping trip. Use details and examples from what you read, along with your own ideas and experience, to support your explanation.

:ibox:Today you will be writing an informative text. When you write to inform, you

• share what you know about a topic or subject with another person.
• think about what the audience may already know or may want to learn about the topic or subject.
• put your information in a logical order.
• use examples, definitions, and specific details to make the information clear and interesting to your audience.

After you have read the passages, and before you begin writing, think about

• what you already know about what might make a camping trip fun and interesting.
 • why Chaco Culture National Historical Park would be a good place for a camping trip.
• important things you learned by reading the passages.

Now write your response in the space provided.
